messages: 9d68d8143c90f591ac08f2b176ff6211 (22:53): so now i can taste my websites! amazing
9d68d8143c90f591ac08f2b176ff6211 (22:53): i would be hesitant to allow any <smell> tags though...
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:06): what do you use to document your JS ?
9d68d8143c90f591ac08f2b176ff6211 (23:09): http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1221413/what-tools-are-available-for-documenting-javascript
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:10): just were there, but thats not your oppinion :-p
9d68d8143c90f591ac08f2b176ff6211 (23:10): and http://stackoverflow.com/questions/799179/javascript-standard-documentation-tool
9d68d8143c90f591ac08f2b176ff6211 (23:10): well i dont have one
9d68d8143c90f591ac08f2b176ff6211 (23:10): so i just refer to stac overflow
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:10): stack is usually right
9d68d8143c90f591ac08f2b176ff6211 (23:11): I've usually went with whatever methods are in place
9d68d8143c90f591ac08f2b176ff6211 (23:12): Last project it meant almost no documentation, and my current is GWT based so I don't get much chance for JS usage
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:12): i thought about Natural Docs
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (23:13): naturaldocs is for API
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:13): but dont like the command line tool much, and perl dependency
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (23:13): docco is for literate programming
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (23:13): IMHO handwritten docs are best
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:14): not sure i get the idea of docco
9d68d8143c90f591ac08f2b176ff6211 (23:14): ive always gone the manual documentation route
c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3 (23:14): c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f: I‚Äôm pretty sure there is no particularly good idea behind it :)
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (23:15): its good if you want people to read your source to understand your internals
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:15): maybe its a good thing to leave documentation outside the code.. especially if you use a versioning system
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (23:15): but.. that shouldnt be the case for 90% of your users
c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3 (23:15): <a href="code.js">please view source</a>
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:16): oh about users, nobody is going to use my sources but me
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:16): i document for my own enlightenment
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:16): if I put the project away for a year, i need to understand it again :)
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (23:18): c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3, 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 did/do you like writing code without doc metadata in jQuery?
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (23:18): and writing doc by hand (not sure if you guys did or not)
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (23:18): v.s. trying to stuff JSDoc-ish comments above every method?

c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3 (23:19): 2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780: there‚Äôs a separate docs team for jquery that handles the documentation; the only reason that really works is because the api is small
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (23:19): c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3: yeah, I figured
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:19): yeah jQuery is custom format
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (23:19): c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3: it seems like the best idea
c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3 (23:19): Personally for the time being I‚Äôd recommend jsdoc toolkit 2
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (23:19): c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3: alot of the time you don't have to be good at explaining things (or at written language) to be good at writing code, :)
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:20): c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3, isnt jsdoc toolkit just another API generator? it doesnt change the actual JSDoc format right?
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (23:20): c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3: and I'm not sure if I'm a fan of the other JS libs that embed jsdoc comments >_> <_<
c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3 (23:20): beyond just being a reasonable and common format for documentation, smart IDEs like Komodo parse and use them to improve code intelligence
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:20): WebStorm/PHPStorm/IDEA also smart :)
c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3 (23:20): c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f: jsdoc toolkit supercedes jsdoc
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (23:20): c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3: so if you're hovering over a method it'll give you metadata about it?
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:21): c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3, but you still use @param and @return etc. ?
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:21): Closure Compiler very much depends on JSDoc too
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:21): sometimes it can't understand your code, if using an API like say mootools
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:21): because mootools overrides the standard Element etc.
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (23:21): c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f: closure compiler uses @return as a type hint, no?
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:22): no not those.. but I had to use @this {Type} to make it understand the this object, otherwise i got "Dangerous use of the global this object"
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:22): as advanced compilation flattens your code
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:22): but that actually broke my IDE's intellisense
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:23): so currently I can't get Mootools and Closure cooperating
c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3 (23:23): CC has a bunch of different hints that it uses depending upon what mode you are running it in
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:23): yes.. but even at simple compiling i couldnt get rid of all warnings
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (23:23): you could use >_> <_< YUI Compressor
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:23): now I just use it to whitespace, concatenate and prettyprint
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (23:24): http://my.opera.com/haavard/blog/2011/06/22/microsoft
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:24): YUI? well yeah but thats Yahoo.. :)
c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3 (23:24): 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049: that was pretty excellent. :)
c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3 (23:25): c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f: I dunno what crazy flags you were using; by default CC barely peeps
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (23:25): c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3: probably advanced mode
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:25): http://minimalreadership.blogspot.com/2011/02/mootools-and-closure-compiler.html
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:25): im not the only one who hit a wall with mootools :)
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (23:25): c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3: but even then it doesn't look at that, iirc
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:26): also closure compiler depends on externs files, and no such for mootools
c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3 (23:26): c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f: you don‚Äôt need an externs file unless you are trying to do advanced optimizations
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:26): and you can't ignore files and even specific warnigns... so basically you have to fix third party code to make everything compile
c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3 (23:26): you don‚Äôt need *any* code hinting except for advanced optimizations
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:27): I need externs.. even in simple mode

c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3 (23:27): and unless you have written your code from the start to work with advanced optimizations and know exactly what that entails, your code will *never* work in advanced optimization mode
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (23:27): c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3: does anybody do this that you know of?

c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:27): probably.. and that's where I think closure compiler gets a bit over the top for me :) i dont want to change my coding habits, I just want code that follows conventions
c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3 (23:27): c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f: I don‚Äôt know what to tell you. I used to use CC without externs in simple mode all the time.
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:27): at least I can Lint
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (23:28): c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3, 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 I know jQuery uses CC but I doubt they rewrote the lib for this purpose
c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3 (23:28): 2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780: no, jquery uses uglifyjs.
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:28): c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3.. if I dont include webkit_console.js extern i can't even compile console.log("test");
c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3 (23:28): it used to use cc, then we changed it
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (23:28): c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3: my bad, they used CC in the past, right?
c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3 (23:28): because uglify is faster and better.
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:28): i dont even use closure as an obfuscator
c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3 (23:28): c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f: ur doin it wrang.
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:29): c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3, enlighten me :)
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (23:29): even web inspector uses uglify, lol, and that's 50% google
c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3 (23:29): c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f: remove the command-line flags you have added to cause CC to do all the extra checks that cause errors
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:29): c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3, oh you see I use the Ant task
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:29): so I have not access to flags
c2eb257d1afa6da62c7dd11790e063f3 (23:31): c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f: I don‚Äôt have ant.
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:31): http://code.google.com/p/closure-compiler/source/browse/trunk/src/com/google/javascript/jscomp/ant/CompileTask.java
c52b3450e529b712b0cc1d6170b1943f (23:31): that's pretty much what I can change
